result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John T Taylor Sr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John T Taylor in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant John T Taylor in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF105, 14CF141

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification statutes. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF105 Counts 1, 2 and 7 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2 and 7.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 3 thru 6 in 14CF105 are dismissed and read-in. 
14CF141 is dismissed and read-in in its entirety. 
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed and copies forwarded to parties no later than 2/20/15.
Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court.  Atty Louis J Molepske Jr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard were 14CF105 and 14CF141.

8:49 a.m.  Court calls case.
Case will be set for a Pre-Trial.

BY THE COURT:
Hearing date set for August 25, 2014 @ 8:30 a.m.  for Pre-Trial Conferernce 
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

State has filed an information.

Atty Kryshak has received a copy of the information, waives reading and enters a NOT GUILTY plea.

Atty Kryshak addresses the Court regarding bond, requests modification for reasons stated on the record.
Defendant is on disability. 

Atty Isherwood addresses the Court, there has not been any new information, this is the fourth request of bond modification. Defendant is a sex offender. 

BY THE COURT:
Court denies request of bond modification.

3:33 PM Court is going to adjourn for the day.

Defendant John T Taylor in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Defendant John T Taylor in custody. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:22 PM Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states appearances.

Both parties are prepared to proceed.

3:23 PM Jeff Coey is called and sworn in, detective.
Direct examination by Atty Isherwood.
Witness identifies Defendant.
3:26 PM Cross-examination by Atty Kryshak.

3:29 PM Witness may step down.

Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and Defendant has committed it.
  
Based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
from Defendant re: wage assignment request
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John T Taylor in court with attorney Gary J Kryshak. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter has been held over from 1:30 p.m.  Bond to be set at this time.

No contact direct/indirect contact with J.M.V.
**Amended per stipulation and order to include:  The defendant can have contact with his son, John Taylor, Jr., in writing.** 10/14/14

Defendant John T Taylor appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica F Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gary J Kryshak in court. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint received in court today and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
State requests $500 cash bond: No contact with victim J.V.
Bond will be consider later at 3:00 p.m. today.
